def old_version_separate_flight_and_system_filefrom_log_sharing_flight_df(log_sharing_flight_df):
    # read the df of all the log index file
    index_log_file_sharing_flight_df = log_sharing_flight_df
    
    vol_files_filter_expression = (F.col("Is_Vol") == True)
    system_files_filter_expression = (F.col("Is_System") == True)
    
    # We separate the previous df in 2 smaller df one with the flight file ant the other with the system file, both of them sorted by date
    vol_files_filtered_df = index_log_file_sharing_flight_df.filter(vol_files_filter_expression).orderBy(F.col("File_date_as_TimestampType").asc())
    system_files_filtered_df = index_log_file_sharing_flight_df.filter(system_files_filter_expression).orderBy(F.col("File_date_as_TimestampType").asc())
    return vol_files_filtered_df, system_files_filtered_df
    
def separate_flight_file_from_log_sharing_flight_df(log_sharing_flight_df):
    # read the df of all the log index file
    index_log_file_sharing_flight_df = log_sharing_flight_df
    vol_files_filter_expression = (F.col("Is_Vol") == True)
    # We separate the previous df in 2 smaller df one with the flight file ant the other with the system file, both of them sorted by date
    vol_files_filtered_df = index_log_file_sharing_flight_df.filter(vol_files_filter_expression).orderBy(F.col("File_date_as_TimestampType").asc())
    return vol_files_filtered_df

def separate_system_file_from_log_sharing_flight_df(log_sharing_flight_df):
    # read the df of all the log index file
    index_log_file_sharing_flight_df = log_sharing_flight_df
    system_files_filter_expression = (F.col("Is_System") == True)
    # We separate the previous df in 2 smaller df one with the flight file ant the other with the system file, both of them sorted by date
    system_files_filtered_df = index_log_file_sharing_flight_df.filter(system_files_filter_expression).orderBy(F.col("File_date_as_TimestampType").asc())
    return system_files_filtered_df

def is_SN_a_known_7X_serial_number(searched_SN, known_7X_SN_list = ['SN267', 'SN268', 'SN269', 'SN270', '267', '268', '269', '270', 267, 268, 269, 270]):
    return searched_SN in known_7X_SN_list

def is_SN_a_known_8X_serial_number(searched_SN, known_8X_SN_list = ['SN412', 'SN425', 'SN449', 'SN455', 'SN466', 'SN488', '412', '425', '449', '455', '466', 412, 425, 449, 455, 466, 488]):
    return searched_SN in known_8X_SN_list
    
def is_aircraft_model_number_a_known_Falcon_code(searched_aircraft_model, known_Falcon_code = ["0420", "0580", "420", "580", 420, 580]):
    return searched_aircraft_model in known_Falcon_code

def get_vol_file_name_from_vol_files_filtered_df(volFiles_filtered_df):
    # Since vol_files_filtered_df was sorted by date (File_date_as_TimestampType) in a previous function, we can extract all the infos we need reading only the first row
    first_row = volFiles_filtered_df.first()
    value_1_IRYS2_or_PERFOS = first_row["IRYS2_or_PERFOS"]
    value_2_File_aircraft_model = first_row["File_aircraft_model"]
    # If value_2_File_aircraft_model is not a recognised value change the code with an absormal value
    if not is_aircraft_model_number_a_known_Falcon_code(value_2_File_aircraft_model):
        value_2_File_aircraft_model = "0000"
        
    #value_3_File_SN = str(first_row["File_SN"])
    value_3_File_SN = strip_non_numeric_char_from_string(first_row["File_SN"])
    # If value_3_File_SN is not a recognised value change the code with an absormal value
    if not (is_SN_a_known_7X_serial_number(value_3_File_SN) or is_SN_a_known_8X_serial_number(value_3_File_SN)):
        value_3_File_SN = "000"
        
    value_4_File_date_as_String = first_row["File_date_as_String"]
    # The letter t was cut of in previous transformation to keep only digits
    value_5_missing_letter_t = "t"
    #value_6_vol_file_extension = ".parquet"
    
    vol_file_complete_name = value_1_IRYS2_or_PERFOS + value_2_File_aircraft_model + value_3_File_SN + "_" + value_4_File_date_as_String + value_5_missing_letter_t
    return vol_file_complete_name #, value_2_File_aircraft_model, value_3_File_SN

def collect_a_df_column_into_a_list(df, column_name_string):
    values_list = df.select(column_name_string).rdd.flatMap(lambda x: x).collect()
    return values_list

def search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation(Log_files_Index_Dir_path = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_current_State_and_Index/*"):
    processing_name = "search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
    finding_common_flight_update_logs_threads = []
    list_of_row_files_without_a_Flight_file_name = []
    number_of_file_not_yet_associated_to_a_flight = 0
    no_errors_during_processing = None
    list_of_new_flights_found = []
    # Find all the logs files where the value of Flight_file_name is still None (files not associated with a flight file yet)
    files_without_a_Flight_file_name_filter_expression = (F.col("Flight_file_name").isNull())
    try:
        index_log_file_without_a_Flight_file_name_df = read_all_index_log_files_as_a_single_df(Log_files_Index_Dir_path).filter(files_without_a_Flight_file_name_filter_expression)
        number_of_file_not_yet_associated_to_a_flight = index_log_file_without_a_Flight_file_name_df.count()
    except Exception as Error_1_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation:
        current_error_name = "Error_1_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
        current_error_message = str(Error_1_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation)
        current_data_processed = Log_files_Index_Dir_path
        log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
        
    # Collect the values of the column file_name_no_extension into a list (the names of the files without extension that can be used to interact with the logs)
    try:
        list_of_row_files_without_a_Flight_file_name = index_log_file_without_a_Flight_file_name_df.select("file_name_no_extension").rdd.flatMap(lambda x: x).collect()
    except Exception as Error_2_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation:
        current_error_name = "Error_2_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
        current_error_message = str(Error_2_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation)
        current_data_processed = Log_files_Index_Dir_path
        log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
    
    # While the list is not empty, process the first file of the list
    try:
        while list_of_row_files_without_a_Flight_file_name != []:
            single_new_flight = []
            single_new_flight_name = "No_Flight_Identified"
            single_new_flight_raw_files_list = []
            updated_log_values_dict = {"Flight_file_name":"No_Flight_Identified"}
            file_name_without_extension_to_analyse = list_of_row_files_without_a_Flight_file_name[0]
            # files_sharing_flight_df is a dataframe where each row represent the data of a raw csv file. The dataframe regroup all the file identified as a part of the same flight/vol : same SN and and a maximum time delta difference of 220 seconds
            try:
                files_sharing_flight_df = find_files_sharing_the_same_flight_as_rawFileName(file_name_without_extension_to_analyse)
            except Exception as Error_8_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation:
                current_error_name = "Error_8_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
                current_error_message = str(Error_8_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation)
                current_data_processed = file_name_without_extension_to_analyse
                log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
            
            # Using the files_sharing_flight_df, identify the files that belong to the future flight/vol file (the IRYS2 or PERFOS files, as opposed to the systems files)
            try:
                only_vol_flight_files_filtered_df = separate_flight_file_from_log_sharing_flight_df(files_sharing_flight_df)
            except Exception as Error_4_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation:
                current_error_name = "Error_4_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
                current_error_message = str(Error_4_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation)
                current_data_processed = file_name_without_extension_to_analyse
                log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
            
            # Find the name of the future flight/vol file
            try:
                flight_vol_file_name_without_extension = get_vol_file_name_from_vol_files_filtered_df(only_vol_flight_files_filtered_df)
                single_new_flight_name = flight_vol_file_name_without_extension
            except Exception as Error_5_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation:
                current_error_name = "Error_5_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
                current_error_message = str(Error_5_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation)
                current_data_processed = file_name_without_extension_to_analyse
                log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
            
            # Dict of values to update in the logs files
            try:
                updated_log_values_dict["Flight_file_name"] = flight_vol_file_name_without_extension
            except Exception as Error_6_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation:
                current_error_name = "Error_6_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
                current_error_message = str(Error_6_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation)
                current_data_processed = file_name_without_extension_to_analyse
                log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
            
            # List the current list identified as sharing the same flight
            try:
                list_of_row_files_to_update_with_a_Flight_file_name = files_sharing_flight_df.select("file_name_no_extension").rdd.flatMap(lambda x: x).collect()
                single_new_flight_raw_files_list = list_of_row_files_to_update_with_a_Flight_file_name
            except Exception as Error_7_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation:
                current_error_name = "Error_7_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
                current_error_message = str(Error_7_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation)
                current_data_processed = file_name_without_extension_to_analyse
                log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
            
            # Use threading to parallelize the list of update both logs jobs
            try:
                for file_name_without_extension_to_update in list_of_row_files_to_update_with_a_Flight_file_name:
                    thread = threading.Thread(target=update_both_log_files_with_success_accumulators, args=(file_name_without_extension_to_update, updated_log_values_dict))
                    finding_common_flight_update_logs_threads.append(thread)
                    thread.start()
                # Wait for all threads to finish
                for thread in finding_common_flight_update_logs_threads:
                    thread.join()
            except Exception as Error_9_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation:
                current_error_name = "Error_9_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
                current_error_message = str(Error_9_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation)
                current_data_processed = file_name_without_extension_to_analyse
                log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")

            # Since the list_of_row_files_to_update_with_a_Flight_file_name should be updated by the previous step, remove thoses values from list_of_row_files_without_a_Flight_file_name, to avoid processing the same files multiples times during the loops
            try:
                for values_to_remove in list_of_row_files_to_update_with_a_Flight_file_name:
                    list_of_row_files_without_a_Flight_file_name.remove(values_to_remove)
            except Exception as Error_10_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation:
                current_error_name = "Error_10_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
                current_error_message = str(Error_10_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation)
                current_data_processed = file_name_without_extension_to_analyse
                log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
            
            single_new_flight = [single_new_flight_name, single_new_flight_raw_files_list]
            list_of_new_flights_found.append(single_new_flight)

    except Exception as Error_3_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation:
        current_error_name = "Error_3_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
        current_error_message = str(Error_3_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation)
        current_data_processed = list_of_row_files_without_a_Flight_file_name
        log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
    
    # Retreve accumulated values
    number_of_successfull_pair_of_log_files_updated = successfull_pair_of_log_files_updated_acc.value
    number_of_failled_pair_of_log_files_updated = failled_pair_of_log_files_updated_acc.value
    if (number_of_file_not_yet_associated_to_a_flight == number_of_successfull_pair_of_log_files_updated) and (number_of_failled_pair_of_log_files_updated == 0):
        no_errors_during_processing = True
    else:
        no_errors_during_processing = False
    return processing_name, number_of_file_not_yet_associated_to_a_flight, number_of_successfull_pair_of_log_files_updated, number_of_failled_pair_of_log_files_updated, no_errors_during_processing, list_of_new_flights_found

def create_basic_processing_log_df_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation(processing_name, number_of_file_not_yet_associated_to_a_flight = None, number_of_successfull_pair_of_log_files_updated = None, number_of_failled_pair_of_log_files_updated = None, no_errors_during_processing = None, number_of_error_log_files_before_processing = None, processing_starting_date = None):
	fields = [StructField("Processing_Name", StringType(),True),
	  StructField("Number_of_Files_initially_not_yet_associated_to_a_flight", IntegerType(),True),
	  StructField("Number_of_successfull_pair_of_log_files_updated", IntegerType(),True),
	  StructField("Number_of_failled_pair_of_log_files_updated", IntegerType(),True),
	  StructField("No_Errors_during_processing", StringType(),True),
	  StructField("Number_of_error_log_files_before_processing", IntegerType(),True),
	  StructField("Processing_starting_date", TimestampType(),True),
	 ]
	schema = StructType(fields)
	# load data
	data = [[processing_name, number_of_file_not_yet_associated_to_a_flight, number_of_successfull_pair_of_log_files_updated, number_of_failled_pair_of_log_files_updated, no_errors_during_processing, number_of_error_log_files_before_processing, processing_starting_date]]
	df = spark.createDataFrame(data, schema)
	# Add a column with the curreent_timestamp to trace the date of the last modification
	df = df.withColumn("Update_Date", F.current_timestamp())
	# Add a column with the duration of the process
	df = df.withColumn('Processing_Duration_in_minutes', F.round((F.col("Update_Date").cast("long") - F.col('Processing_starting_date').cast("long")) / 60, 2))
	# Find the current number of error files now that the processing is over
	error_logs_path = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs"
	current_number_of_error_log_files = len(listdir(error_logs_path))
	# Add a column with the current_number_of_error_log_files
	df = df.withColumn("Number_of_error_log_files_after_processing", F.lit(current_number_of_error_log_files))
	df = df.withColumn("New_error_messages", F.col("Number_of_error_log_files_after_processing")-F.col("Number_of_error_log_files_before_processing"))
	return df

def create_New_Flight_processing_log_df_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation(output_list_of_new_flights_found):
    new_flights_found_data_df = spark.createDataFrame(output_list_of_new_flights_found, ["New_Flight_Detected", "Flight_raw_file_list"])
    return new_flights_found_data_df

def log_Processing_results_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation(Processing_name, Processing_Dated_Directory_name_path, Number_of_file_not_yet_associated_to_a_flight = None, Number_of_successfull_pair_of_log_files_updated = None, Number_of_failled_pair_of_log_files_updated = None, No_errors_during_processing = None, List_of_new_flights_found = None, Number_of_error_log_files_before_processing = None, Processing_starting_date = None):
    try:
        basic_processing_folder_name_string = "Processing_results_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
        basic_processing_log_name_string = "Results_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
        Processing_log_file_name = basic_processing_log_name_string + ".parquet"
        # Create the basic df for the log file
        Processing_log_df = create_basic_processing_log_df_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation(Processing_name, Number_of_file_not_yet_associated_to_a_flight, Number_of_successfull_pair_of_log_files_updated, Number_of_failled_pair_of_log_files_updated, No_errors_during_processing, Number_of_error_log_files_before_processing, Processing_starting_date)
        Processing_Log_File_Dir_Path = Processing_Dated_Directory_name_path + "/" + basic_processing_folder_name_string
        #Processing_Log_File_Dir_Path = Processing_Dated_Directory_name_path
        # Save the log
        write_Processing_Log_File(Processing_log_df, Processing_log_file_name, Processing_Log_File_Dir_Path)
    except Exception as Error_1_log_Processing_results_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation:
        current_error_name = "Error_1_log_Processing_results_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
        current_error_message = str(Error_1_log_Processing_results_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation)
        current_data_processed = Processing_name + " " + Processing_Dated_Directory_name_path
        log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
        
    try:
        basic_processing_folder_name_string = "Processing_Output_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
        basic_processing_log_name_string = "Output_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
        Processing_log_file_name = basic_processing_log_name_string + ".parquet"
        # Create the basic df for the log file
        Processing_log_df = create_New_Flight_processing_log_df_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation(List_of_new_flights_found)
        # Explode the list of column into multiple rows
        exploded_df = Processing_log_df.select(F.col("New_Flight_Detected"), explode(F.col("Flight_raw_file_list")).alias("Flight_raw_file"))
        Processing_Log_File_Dir_Path = Processing_Dated_Directory_name_path + "/" + basic_processing_folder_name_string
        #Processing_Log_File_Dir_Path = Processing_Dated_Directory_name_path
        # Save the log
        #write_Processing_Log_File(Processing_log_df, Processing_log_file_name, Processing_Log_File_Dir_Path)
        processing_log_file_complete_path = Processing_Log_File_Dir_Path + "/" + Processing_log_file_name
        exploded_df.write.mode("overwrite").parquet(processing_log_file_complete_path)
    except Exception as Error_2_log_Processing_results_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation:
        current_error_name = "Error_2_log_Processing_results_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation"
        current_error_message = str(Error_2_log_Processing_results_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation)
        current_data_processed = Processing_name + " " + Processing_Dated_Directory_name_path
        log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")

############################################################################################################################################################################################
###############                            Final function that call all the transformation steps and log the results                          ###########################
############################################################################################################################################################################################



def old_version_1_complete_transformation_of_raw_files_into_vol_files(New_raw_files_Dir_path, legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path, dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path):
    error_logs_path = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs"
    #STEP 1 : Initialise the log files for the test path
    # Find the current number of error logs
    number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_1 = len(listdir(error_logs_path))
    # Save the current timestamp
    process_starting_date_before_step_1 = spark.sql("SELECT current_timestamp() as current_time").collect()[0]["current_time"]
    # Initiate the result directory path
    Processing_dated_directory_path = initiate_new_processing_directory()
    
    processing_name_step_1, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir_step_1, number_of_index_logs_created_step_1, number_of_archive_logs_created_step_1, no_errors_during_processing_step_1, number_of_files_with_invalid_name_step_1 = initiate_log_files_from_New_raw_files(New_raw_files_Dir_path, legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path, dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path)
    # Log the results of step 1
    
    log_Processing_results_for_initiate_raw_files_logs(processing_name_step_1, Processing_dated_directory_path, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir_step_1, number_of_index_logs_created_step_1, number_of_archive_logs_created_step_1, no_errors_during_processing_step_1, number_of_files_with_invalid_name_step_1, number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_1, process_starting_date_before_step_1)
    
    #STEP 2 : Copy raw file from New_raw_files_Dir and update the logs
    process_starting_date_before_step_2 = spark.sql("SELECT current_timestamp() as current_time").collect()[0]["current_time"]
    number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_2 = len(listdir(error_logs_path))
    processing_name_step_2, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir_step_2, number_of_files_copied_into_dated_dir_step_2, number_of_files_moved_into_legacy_dir_step_2, no_errors_during_processing_step_2, number_of_files_not_completely_processed_step_2 = copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders(New_raw_files_Dir_path)
    log_Processing_results_for_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders(processing_name_step_2, Processing_dated_directory_path, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir_step_2, number_of_files_copied_into_dated_dir_step_2, number_of_files_moved_into_legacy_dir_step_2, no_errors_during_processing_step_2, number_of_files_not_completely_processed_step_2, number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_2, process_starting_date_before_step_2)

def old_version_2_complete_transformation_of_raw_files_into_vol_files(New_raw_files_Dir_path, legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path, dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path):
    error_logs_path = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs"

    # Find the current number of error logs

    # Initiate the result directory path

    processing_name_step_1, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir_step_1, number_of_index_logs_created_step_1, number_of_archive_logs_created_step_1, no_errors_during_processing_step_1, number_of_files_with_invalid_name_step_1 = initiate_log_files_from_New_raw_files(New_raw_files_Dir_path, legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path, dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path)
    # Log the results of step 1
    
    log_Processing_results_for_initiate_raw_files_logs(processing_name_step_1, Processing_dated_directory_path, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir_step_1, number_of_index_logs_created_step_1, number_of_archive_logs_created_step_1, no_errors_during_processing_step_1, number_of_files_with_invalid_name_step_1, number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_1, process_starting_date_before_step_1)
    
    #STEP 2 : Copy raw file from New_raw_files_Dir and update the logs
    process_starting_date_before_step_2 = spark.sql("SELECT current_timestamp() as current_time").collect()[0]["current_time"]
    number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_2 = len(listdir(error_logs_path))
    processing_name_step_2, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir_step_2, number_of_files_copied_into_dated_dir_step_2, number_of_files_moved_into_legacy_dir_step_2, no_errors_during_processing_step_2, number_of_files_not_completely_processed_step_2 = threading_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders(New_raw_files_Dir_path)
    log_Processing_results_for_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders(processing_name_step_2, Processing_dated_directory_path, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir_step_2, number_of_files_copied_into_dated_dir_step_2, number_of_files_moved_into_legacy_dir_step_2, no_errors_during_processing_step_2, number_of_files_not_completely_processed_step_2, number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_2, process_starting_date_before_step_2)
    
    
def complete_transformation_of_raw_files_into_vol_files(New_raw_files_Dir_path, legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path, dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path):
    error_logs_path = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs"
    #STEP 1 : Initialise the log files for the test path
    # Find the current number of error logs
    number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_1 = len(listdir(error_logs_path))
    # Save the current timestamp
    process_starting_date_before_step_1 = spark.sql("SELECT current_timestamp() as current_time").collect()[0]["current_time"]
    # Initiate the result directory path
    Processing_dated_directory_path = initiate_new_processing_directory()
    
    processing_name_step_1, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir_step_1, number_of_index_logs_created_step_1, number_of_archive_logs_created_step_1, no_errors_during_processing_step_1, number_of_files_with_invalid_name_step_1 = initiate_log_files_from_New_raw_files(New_raw_files_Dir_path, legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path, dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path)
    # Log the results of step 1
    
    log_Processing_results_for_initiate_raw_files_logs(processing_name_step_1, Processing_dated_directory_path, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir_step_1, number_of_index_logs_created_step_1, number_of_archive_logs_created_step_1, no_errors_during_processing_step_1, number_of_files_with_invalid_name_step_1, number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_1, process_starting_date_before_step_1)
    
    #STEP 2 : Copy raw file from New_raw_files_Dir and update the logs
    process_starting_date_before_step_2 = spark.sql("SELECT current_timestamp() as current_time").collect()[0]["current_time"]
    number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_2 = len(listdir(error_logs_path))
    processing_name_step_2, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir_step_2, number_of_files_copied_into_dated_dir_step_2, number_of_files_moved_into_legacy_dir_step_2, no_errors_during_processing_step_2, number_of_files_not_completely_processed_step_2 = threading_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders(New_raw_files_Dir_path)
    log_Processing_results_for_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders(processing_name_step_2, Processing_dated_directory_path, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir_step_2, number_of_files_copied_into_dated_dir_step_2, number_of_files_moved_into_legacy_dir_step_2, no_errors_during_processing_step_2, number_of_files_not_completely_processed_step_2, number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_2, process_starting_date_before_step_2)
    
    #STEP 3 : Find new flight using the log files and update the logs accordingle
    process_starting_date_before_step_3 = spark.sql("SELECT current_timestamp() as current_time").collect()[0]["current_time"]
    number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_3 = len(listdir(error_logs_path))
    processing_name_step_3, number_of_file_not_yet_associated_to_a_flight_step_3, number_of_successfull_pair_of_log_files_updated_step_3, number_of_failled_pair_of_log_files_updated_step_3, no_errors_during_processing_step_3, list_of_new_flights_found_step_3 = search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation()
    log_Processing_results_for_search_and_identify_new_flights_vol_before_transformation(processing_name_step_3, Processing_dated_directory_path, number_of_file_not_yet_associated_to_a_flight_step_3, number_of_successfull_pair_of_log_files_updated_step_3, number_of_failled_pair_of_log_files_updated_step_3, no_errors_during_processing_step_3, list_of_new_flights_found_step_3, number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_3, process_starting_date_before_step_3)

%pyspark

def old_version_1_initiate_log_files_from_New_raw_files(New_raw_files_Dir_path, legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path, dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path):
	Recently_uploaded_SN_dir = listdir(New_raw_files_Dir_path)
	for SN_dir in Recently_uploaded_SN_dir:
		Recently_uploaded_file_path_list = listdir(SN_dir)
		for new_raw_file_path in Recently_uploaded_file_path_list:
			file_name_with_extension = extract_filename_with_extension(new_raw_file_path)
			file_name_without_extension = extract_filename_without_extension(new_raw_file_path)
			file_type = "Raw"
			file_SN = get_aircraft_SN_complete_from_file_name(file_name_without_extension)
			file_aircraft_model = get_aircraft_Model_ID_from_file_name(file_name_without_extension)
			file_date_as_dateTime = get_date_from_ACMF_csv_file_name(file_name_without_extension)
			file_date_as_string = get_date_as_numeric_string_from_ACMF_csv_filee_name(file_name_without_extension)
			raw_file_date_year_string, raw_file_date_month_string, raw_file_date_day_string = get_year_month_day_as_numeric_string_from_ACMF_csv_filee_name(file_name_without_extension)
			Raw_file_legacy_folder_path = legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path + "/" + file_SN + "/" + file_name_with_extension
			Raw_file_dated_folder_path = dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path + "/" + file_SN + "/" + raw_file_date_year_string + "/" + raw_file_date_month_string + "/" + raw_file_date_day_string + "/" + file_name_with_extension
			# Create a log df with the previous informations
			log_df = create_basic_log_df(file_name_without_extension, file_name_with_extension, file_type, file_date_as_dateTime, file_SN, file_aircraft_model, Raw_file_legacy_folder_path, Raw_file_dated_folder_path)
			# save the df
			write_Log_Files(log_df, file_name_without_extension)

def old_version_2_initiate_log_files_from_New_raw_files(New_raw_files_Dir_path, legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path, dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path):
	Recently_uploaded_SN_dir = listdir(New_raw_files_Dir_path)
	for SN_dir in Recently_uploaded_SN_dir:
		Recently_uploaded_file_path_list = listdir(SN_dir)
		for new_raw_file_path in Recently_uploaded_file_path_list:
			file_name_with_extension = extract_filename_with_extension(new_raw_file_path)
			file_name_without_extension = extract_filename_without_extension(new_raw_file_path)
			file_extension = identify_extension(new_raw_file_path)
			file_type = "Raw"
			# Find if the file name is a valid format:
			valid_file_name = is_file_name_valid(new_raw_file_path)
			if valid_file_name:
			    file_name_with_extension, file_name_without_extension, file_extension, file_full_ID, file_SN_plus_num, file_ac_model, file_date_as_dateTime, file_date_as_str, IRYS2_in_fileName, PERFOS_in_fileName, FAIL_in_fileName, TRD_begining_file_name, MUX_begining_file_name, file_part_of_Vol, IRYS2orPERFOS, file_part_of_System, file_system_name = get_all_infos_from_file_path(new_raw_file_path)
			    raw_file_date_year_string, raw_file_date_month_string, raw_file_date_day_string = get_year_month_day_as_numeric_string_from_ACMF_csv_filee_name(file_name_without_extension)

def old_version_3_initiate_log_files_from_New_raw_files(New_raw_files_Dir_path, legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path, dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path):
    # Variable used to evaluate the processing results
    processing_name = "Initiate raw files logs"
    number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir = 0
    number_of_index_logs_created = 0
    number_of_archive_logs_created = 0
    no_errors_during_processing = None
    number_of_files_with_invalid_name = 0
    Processing_dated_directory_path = initiate_new_processing_directory()
    Recently_uploaded_SN_dir = listdir(New_raw_files_Dir_path)
    for SN_dir in Recently_uploaded_SN_dir:
        Recently_uploaded_file_path_list = listdir(SN_dir)
        number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir += len(Recently_uploaded_file_path_list)
        for new_raw_file_path in Recently_uploaded_file_path_list:
            file_name_with_extension = extract_filename_with_extension(new_raw_file_path)
            file_name_without_extension = extract_filename_without_extension(new_raw_file_path)
            file_extension = identify_extension(new_raw_file_path)
            file_type = "Raw"
            # Find if the file name is a valid format:
            valid_file_name = is_file_name_valid(new_raw_file_path)
            if valid_file_name:
                file_name_with_extension, file_name_without_extension, file_extension, file_full_ID, file_SN_plus_num, file_ac_model, file_date_as_dateTime, file_date_as_str, IRYS2_in_fileName, PERFOS_in_fileName, FAIL_in_fileName, TRD_begining_file_name, MUX_begining_file_name, file_part_of_Vol, IRYS2orPERFOS, file_part_of_System, file_system_name = get_all_infos_from_file_path(new_raw_file_path)
                raw_file_date_year_string, raw_file_date_month_string, raw_file_date_day_string = get_year_month_day_as_numeric_string_from_ACMF_csv_filee_name(file_name_without_extension)
                Raw_file_legacy_folder_path = legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path + "/" + file_SN_plus_num + "/" + file_name_with_extension
                Raw_file_dated_folder_path = dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path + "/" + file_SN_plus_num + "/" + raw_file_date_year_string + "/" + raw_file_date_month_string + "/" + raw_file_date_day_string + "/" + file_name_with_extension
                
                log_df = create_basic_log_df(file_name_without_extension, file_name_with_extension, file_extension, file_type, valid_file_name, file_date_as_Timestamp = file_date_as_dateTime, file_date_as_string = file_date_as_str, file_complete_ID = file_full_ID, file_SN = file_SN_plus_num, file_aircraft_model = file_ac_model, file_legacy_folder_path = Raw_file_legacy_folder_path, file_dated_folder_path = Raw_file_dated_folder_path, copy_to_raw_legacy_folder = None, copy_to_raw_dated_folder = None, Flight_file_name = None, TRD_start_file_name = TRD_begining_file_name, MUX_start_file_name = MUX_begining_file_name, IRYS2_in_file_name = IRYS2_in_fileName, PERFOS_in_file_name = PERFOS_in_fileName, FAIL_in_file_name = FAIL_in_fileName, Is_Vol = file_part_of_Vol, IRYS2_or_PERFOS = IRYS2orPERFOS, Is_System = file_part_of_System, System_Name = file_system_name)
                # save the df
                write_Log_Files(log_df, file_name_without_extension)
                number_of_index_logs_created += 1
                number_of_archive_logs_created += 1
            else:
                # Create a log df filled mostly with the default None value since the file name is not recognized
                invalid_file_name_log_df = create_basic_log_df(file_name_without_extension, file_name_with_extension, file_extension, file_type, valid_file_name)
                # save the df
                write_Log_Files(invalid_file_name_log_df, file_name_without_extension)
                number_of_files_with_invalid_name += 1
    # Save the final result
    if (number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir == number_of_index_logs_created) and (number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir == number_of_archive_logs_created) and (number_of_files_with_invalid_name ==0):
        no_errors_during_processing = True
    else:
        no_errors_during_processing = False
    log_Processing_results_for_initiate_raw_files_logs(processing_name, Processing_dated_directory_path, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir, number_of_index_logs_created, number_of_archive_logs_created, no_errors_during_processing, number_of_files_with_invalid_name)


def old_version_update_both_log_files(File_name_without_extension, new_values_per_column_dict, Log_file_index_dir_path = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_current_State_and_Index", Log_file_archive_dir_path = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Log_Archives"):
    # Read the old df (the values in need of update)
    old_log_df = read_Log_file_index_from_file_name(File_name_without_extension, Log_file_index_dir_path)
    # Update the old_log_df by looping through the new values dictionary
    new_log_df = old_log_df
    for column_name  in new_values_per_column_dict.keys():
        new_log_df = update_Log_df_with_new_value(new_log_df, column_name, new_values_per_column_dict[column_name])
    # Update the result in the Update_Date column
    new_log_df = new_log_df.withColumn("Update_Date", F.current_timestamp())
    # The path where to write the files
    log_file_Index_name = "Log_ACMF_Index_" + File_name_without_extension + ".parquet"
    log_files_Archive_name = "Log_ACMF_Archive_" + File_name_without_extension + ".parquet"
    Log_files_Index_complete_path = Log_file_index_dir_path + "/" + log_file_Index_name
    Log_files_Archive_complete_path = Log_file_archive_dir_path + "/" + log_files_Archive_name
    # We write the log twice
    # The file writen in the Index folder only have the most recent date use overwrite mode
    new_log_df.write.mode("overwrite").parquet(Log_files_Index_complete_path)
    # The file writen in the archive folder keep trace of all changes use append mode
    new_log_df.write.mode("append").parquet(Log_files_Archive_complete_path)



#def copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders(New_raw_files_Dir_path, legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path, dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path):
def old_version_1_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders(New_raw_files_Dir_path):
	Recently_uploaded_SN_dir = listdir(New_raw_files_Dir_path)
	for SN_dir in Recently_uploaded_SN_dir:
		Recently_uploaded_file_path_list = listdir(SN_dir)
		for new_raw_file_path in Recently_uploaded_file_path_list:
			file_name_without_extension = extract_filename_without_extension(new_raw_file_path)
			# The default values to update if the copy fail
			updated_log_values_dict = {"Raw_file_legacy_folder_copied":False, "Raw_file_dated_folder_copied":False}
			able_to_read_file_to_copy = False
			Copies_count = 0
			try:
			    # Read the df to copy
			    df_to_copy = spark.read.csv(new_raw_file_path)
			    able_to_read_file_to_copy = True
			except (IOError, ValueError, IllegalArgumentException) as Error_1_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders:
			    able_to_read_file_to_copy = False
			#If the raw file could be red
			if able_to_read_file_to_copy:
			    log_file_infos_dict = get_Log_file_index_parameters_from_file_name(file_name_without_extension)
			    Raw_file_legacy_folder_path = log_file_infos_dict["Raw_file_legacy_folder_path"]
			    Raw_file_dated_folder_path = log_file_infos_dict["Raw_file_dated_folder_path"]
			    # Try writting the first copy
			    try:
			        df_to_copy.coalesce(1).write.mode("ignore").csv(Raw_file_legacy_folder_path)
			        updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_legacy_folder_copied"] = True
			        Copies_count += 1
			    except (IOError, ValueError, IllegalArgumentException) as Error_2_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders:
			        updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_legacy_folder_copied"] = False
			    # Try writting the second copy
			    try:
			        df_to_copy.coalesce(1).write.mode("ignore").csv(Raw_file_dated_folder_path)
			        updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_dated_folder_copied"] = True
			        Copies_count += 1
			    except (IOError, ValueError, IllegalArgumentException) as Error_3_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders:
			        updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_dated_folder_copied"] = False
			#Update both log files using the updated_log_values_dict
			update_both_log_files(file_name_without_extension, updated_log_values_dict)
			if Copies_count == 2:
			    # If all the copies have been made successfully
			    path_to_deleate = new_raw_file_path
			    #Use subprocess to run the HDFS command to delete the file or folder
			    # Be cautious when using this method as it directly interacts with HDFS.
			    subprocess.run(["hadoop", "dfs", "-rm", "-r", path_to_deleate])



def old_version_1_hdfs_check_if_dir_exist_and_create_it_if_not(full_path):
    directory_that_need_to_exist_path = os.path.dirname(full_path)
    # If the parent directory do not exist
    if hdfs_check_if_file_exist(directory_that_need_to_exist_path) == False:
        mkdir_command = ["hadoop", "dfs", "-mkdir", "-p", directory_that_need_to_exist_path]
        grant_all_permission_command_recursive = ["hadoop", "dfs", "-chmod", "-R", "777", directory_that_need_to_exist_path]
        try:
            subprocess.run(mkdir_command, check=True)
            subprocess.run(grant_all_permission_command_recursive, check=True)
        except Exception as Error_1_hdfs_check_if_dir_exist_and_create_it_if_not:
            current_error_name = "Error_1_hdfs_check_if_dir_exist_and_create_it_if_not"
            current_error_message = str(Error_1_hdfs_check_if_dir_exist_and_create_it_if_not)
            current_data_processed = full_path
            log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
    else:
        pass

# Work but cause the writing of a shell error, wich is badly handle by a pyspark paragraph
def old_version_5_delete_empty_parquet_files(folder_path):
    parquet_files = list_parquet_files(folder_path)

    for file_path in parquet_files:
        # Check if the file exists and is empty using Hadoop's fs -test command
        try:
            command = f"hadoop fs -test -e {file_path} && hadoop fs -test -z {file_path}"
            file_exists_and_empty = subprocess.call(command, shell=True)

            if file_exists_and_empty == 0:
                # Delete the entire directory (including the Parquet files and _SUCCESS file)
                command = f"hadoop fs -rm -r {folder_path}"
                subprocess.run(command, shell=True)
                print(f"Deleted empty Parquet directory: {folder_path}")
                # Exit the loop after deleting the directory
                break
        except Exception as Error_1_delete_empty_parquet_files:
            #print(f"Error processing {file_path}: {str(e)}")
            current_error_name = "Error_1_delete_empty_parquet_files"
            current_error_message = str(Error_1_delete_empty_parquet_files)
            current_data_processed = folder_path
            log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")

def old_version_2_complete_transformation_of_raw_files_into_vol_files(New_raw_files_Dir_path, legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path, dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path):
    # Find the current number of error logs
    error_logs_path = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs"
    number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_1 = len(listdir(error_logs_path))
    # Save the current timestamp
    process_starting_date_before_step_1 = spark.sql("SELECT current_timestamp() as current_time").collect()[0]["current_time"]
    # Initiate the result directory path
    Processing_dated_directory_path = initiate_new_processing_directory()
    #STEP 1 : Initialise the log files for the test path
    processing_name, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir, number_of_index_logs_created, number_of_archive_logs_created, no_errors_during_processing, number_of_files_with_invalid_name = initiate_log_files_from_New_raw_files(New_raw_files_Dir_path, legacy_fichier_brut_Folder_path, dated_fichier_brut_Folder_path)
    # Log the results of step 1
    
    log_Processing_results_for_initiate_raw_files_logs(processing_name, Processing_dated_directory_path, number_of_files_initially_in_new_raw_files_dir, number_of_index_logs_created, number_of_archive_logs_created, no_errors_during_processing, number_of_files_with_invalid_name, number_of_error_log_files_before_processing_step_1, process_starting_date_before_step_1)
    #STEP 2 : Copy raw file from New_raw_files_Dir and update the logs
    copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders(New_raw_files_Dir_path)

def new_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders(New_raw_files_Dir_path):
	Recently_uploaded_SN_dir = listdir(New_raw_files_Dir_path)
	for SN_dir in Recently_uploaded_SN_dir:
		print("################################################################################################################")
		print("################################################################################################################")
		print("################################################################################################################")
		print("SN_dir = ", SN_dir)
		Recently_uploaded_file_path_list = listdir(SN_dir)
		for new_raw_file_path in Recently_uploaded_file_path_list:
			print("################################################################################################################")
			print("new_raw_file_path = ", new_raw_file_path)
			file_name_without_extension = extract_filename_without_extension(new_raw_file_path)
			print("file_name_without_extension = ", file_name_without_extension)
			# The default values to update if the copy fail
			updated_log_values_dict = {"Raw_file_legacy_folder_copied":False, "Raw_file_dated_folder_copied":False}
			print("updated_log_values_dict = ", updated_log_values_dict)
			able_to_read_file_to_copy = False
			print("able_to_read_file_to_copy = ", able_to_read_file_to_copy)
			#Files_into_the_right_folder = 0
			copy_to_dated_dir = False
			print("copy_to_dated_dir = ", copy_to_dated_dir)
			moved_to_legacy_dir = False
			print("copy_to_dated_dir = ", copy_to_dated_dir)
			try:
			    # Read the df to copy
			    df_to_copy = spark.read.csv(new_raw_file_path)
			    able_to_read_file_to_copy = True
			    print("able_to_read_file_to_copy = ", able_to_read_file_to_copy)
			except Exception as Error_1_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders:
			#except (IOError, ValueError, IllegalArgumentException,subprocess.CalledProcessError) as Error_1_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders:
			    able_to_read_file_to_copy = False
			    print("Error_1_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders, able_to_read_file_to_copy = ", able_to_read_file_to_copy)
			    
			    current_error_name = "Error_1_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders"
			    current_error_message = str(Error_1_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders)
			    current_data_processed = file_name_without_extension
			    log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
            
			#If the raw file could be red
			if able_to_read_file_to_copy == True:
			    print("able_to_read_file_to_copy = ", able_to_read_file_to_copy)
			    log_file_infos_dict = get_Log_file_index_parameters_from_file_name(file_name_without_extension)
			    Raw_file_legacy_folder_path = log_file_infos_dict["Raw_file_legacy_folder_path"]
			    print("Raw_file_legacy_folder_path = ", Raw_file_legacy_folder_path)
			    Raw_file_dated_folder_path = log_file_infos_dict["Raw_file_dated_folder_path"]
			    print("Raw_file_dated_folder_path = ", Raw_file_dated_folder_path)
			    #Verify that the dir already exist and if not create it
			    try:
			        hdfs_check_if_dir_exist_and_create_it_if_not(Raw_file_dated_folder_path)
			        hdfs_check_if_dir_exist_and_create_it_if_not(Raw_file_legacy_folder_path)
			        print("hdfs_check_if_dir_exist_and_create_it_if_not(Raw_file_dated_folder_path) = ")
			        print("hdfs_check_if_dir_exist_and_create_it_if_not(Raw_file_legacy_folder_path) = ")
			    except Exception as Error_4_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders:
			        current_error_name = "Error_4_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders"
			        print("current_error_name = ", current_error_name)
			        current_error_message = str(Error_4_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders)
			        current_data_processed = file_name_without_extension
			        log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
			    # Try writting the first copy to the dated folder
			    try:
			        #df_to_copy.coalesce(1).write.mode("ignore").csv(Raw_file_legacy_folder_path)
			        #Verify that the dir already exist and if not create it
			        #hdfs_check_if_dir_exist_and_create_it_if_not(Raw_file_dated_folder_path)
			        hdfs_copy_file_from_source_to_destination(new_raw_file_path, Raw_file_dated_folder_path)
			        print("hdfs_copy_file_from_source_to_destination")
			        updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_legacy_folder_copied"] = True
			        print("updated_log_values_dict[Raw_file_legacy_folder_copied]  = ", updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_legacy_folder_copied"] )
			        #Files_into_the_right_folder += 1
			        copy_to_dated_dir = True
			        print("copy_to_dated_dir = ", copy_to_dated_dir)
			    except Exception as Error_2_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders:
			        updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_legacy_folder_copied"] = False
			        print("updated_log_values_dict[Raw_file_legacy_folder_copied] = ", updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_legacy_folder_copied"])
			        current_error_name = "Error_2_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders"
			        print("current_error_name = ", current_error_name)
			        current_error_message = str(Error_2_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders)
			        current_data_processed = file_name_without_extension
			        log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
            
			    # Try moving the file form the New_raw_files_Dir_path to the legacy folder
			    print("Try moving the file form the New_raw_files_Dir_path to the legacy folder")
			    try:
			        # If the file was succefully copied in the dated folder we can move the file to the legacy folder
			        #if Files_into_the_right_folder == 1:
			        if copy_to_dated_dir == True:
			            print("copy_to_dated_dir = ",copy_to_dated_dir)
			            #df_to_copy.coalesce(1).write.mode("ignore").csv(Raw_file_dated_folder_path)
			            #Verify that the dir already exist and if not create it
			            #hdfs_check_if_dir_exist_and_create_it_if_not(Raw_file_legacy_folder_path)
			            legacy_folder_parent_path = os.path.dirname(Raw_file_legacy_folder_path)
			            print("Raw_file_legacy_folder_path = ", Raw_file_legacy_folder_path)
			            print("legacy_folder_parent_path = ", legacy_folder_parent_path)
			            hdfs_move_file_from_source_to_destination(new_raw_file_path, legacy_folder_parent_path, Raw_file_legacy_folder_path)
			            updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_dated_folder_copied"] = True
			            print("updated_log_values_dict[Raw_file_dated_folder_copied] = ", updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_dated_folder_copied"])
			            #Files_into_the_right_folder += 1
			            moved_to_legacy_dir = True
			            print("moved_to_legacy_dir = ", moved_to_legacy_dir)
			        else : 
			            updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_dated_folder_copied"] = False
			            print("updated_log_values_dict[Raw_file_dated_folder_copied] = ", updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_dated_folder_copied"])
			    except Exception as Error_3_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders:
			        updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_dated_folder_copied"] = False
			        current_error_name = "Error_3_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders"
			        print("updated_log_values_dict[Raw_file_dated_folder_copied] = ", updated_log_values_dict["Raw_file_dated_folder_copied"])
			        print("current_error_name = ", current_error_name)
			        current_error_message = str(Error_3_copy_new_raw_file_into_appropriate_folders)
			        current_data_processed = file_name_without_extension
			        log_error_message(current_error_name, current_data_processed, current_error_message, "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_Error_Logs")
            
			#Update both log files using the updated_log_values_dict
			print("update_both_log_files(file_name_without_extension, updated_log_values_dict)")
			update_both_log_files(file_name_without_extension, updated_log_values_dict)
			# If the file in New_raw_files_Dir_path still exist and both files are present in the legacy and dated dir (ex if the file was already present in the legacy dir so the file could not be moved) THEN delete the file
			is_file_stil_present_in_New_raw_files_Dir_path = hdfs_check_if_file_exist(new_raw_file_path)
			print("is_file_stil_present_in_New_raw_files_Dir_path = ", is_file_stil_present_in_New_raw_files_Dir_path)
			#if (Files_into_the_right_folder == 2) and (is_file_stil_present_in_New_raw_files_Dir_path == True):
			if (copy_to_dated_dir == True) and (moved_to_legacy_dir == True) and (is_file_stil_present_in_New_raw_files_Dir_path == True):
			    print("(copy_to_dated_dir == True) and (moved_to_legacy_dir == True) and (is_file_stil_present_in_New_raw_files_Dir_path == True)")
			    # If all the copies have been made successfully
			    path_to_delete = new_raw_file_path
			    waiting_for_deletion_dir_path = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Processing_leftovers/Moving_files_out_of_New_raw_files/Files_WAITING_FOR_DELETION"
			    path_to_verify_before_moving = waiting_for_deletion_dir_path + "/" + os.path.basename(path_to_delete)
			    hdfs_move_file_from_source_to_destination(path_to_delete, waiting_for_deletion_dir_path, path_to_verify_before_moving)
			    #Use subprocess to run the HDFS command to delete the file or folder
			    # Be cautious when using this method as it directly interacts with HDFS.
			    #subprocess.run(["hadoop", "dfs", "-rm", "-r", path_to_delete])
			    print("file_still_present")

paragraphs.title: Modify the rights/permission for reading, writing/deleting, execution of a file or folder (specifically those earn by yarn ?)
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
directory_path_that_need_rights_modification = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Test_fichier_brut_par_mois/SN449"
# code used to set rights/permission for reading, writing/deleting, execution. "777" is the default code to grant all rights
rights_or_permission_to_set = "777"

# Modify rights for a directory recursively -> all sub-folders will have the same setting
grant_all_permission_command_recursive = ["hdfs", "dfs", "-chmod", "-R", rights_or_permission_to_set, directory_path_that_need_rights_modification]

# Modify rights for a directory NON recursively -> only the specific folder rights will be updated
grant_all_permission_command_NON_recursive = ["hdfs", "dfs", "-chmod", rights_or_permission_to_set, directory_path_that_need_rights_modification]

# Ude the chosen command in a subprocess
subprocess.run(grant_all_permission_command_recursive, check=True)

paragraphs.title: Modify the rights/permission for reading, writing/deleting, execution of a file or folder (specifically those earn by yarn ?)
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
#Use to chmod all the directories created by yarn, during the copy of the raw files in the dated dir
# Not the most efficient method since it use chmod on all children inside parent_directory_path_that_need_rights_modification
def modify_directories_right_recurssively(parent_directory_path_that_need_rights_modification = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Test_fichier_brut_par_mois", selected_rights = "777"):
    # Recursivelly modify the right of all the subfolder listed
    list_of_dir_to_chmod = []
    SN_dir_path_list = listdir(parent_directory_path_that_need_rights_modification)
    for SN_dir in SN_dir_path_list:
    	list_of_SN_Year_dir_to_chmod = listdir(SN_dir)
    	# Variable used to evaluate the processing results
    	list_of_dir_to_chmod.extend(list_of_SN_Year_dir_to_chmod)
    # The list_of_dir_to_chmod is complete ()
    rights_or_permission_to_set = selected_rights
    for dir_to_chmod in list_of_dir_to_chmod:
        # Modify rights for a directory recursively -> all sub-folders will have the same setting, remove -R for the non recursive version
        grant_all_permission_command_recursive = ["hdfs", "dfs", "-chmod", "-R", rights_or_permission_to_set, dir_to_chmod]
        subprocess.run(grant_all_permission_command_recursive, check=True)

modify_directories_right_recurssively()

paragraphs.title: Find the owner of a path or folder
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
# Define the folder path for which you want to find the owner
folder_path = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Test_fichier_brut_par_mois"

# Use the subprocess module to run the getfacl command
try:
    # Run the getfacl command and capture the output
    #acl_output_bytes = subprocess.check_output(["hadoop", "fs", "-getfacl", folder_path], stderr=subprocess.STDOUT)
    acl_output_bytes = subprocess.check_output(["hdfs", "dfs", "-getfacl", folder_path], stderr=subprocess.STDOUT)
    
    # Decode the output to a string
    acl_output = acl_output_bytes.decode('utf-8')

    # Parse the output to extract the owner information
    lines = acl_output.split('\n')
    owner_line = next(line for line in lines if line.startswith("# owner:"))
    owner = owner_line.split(':')[1].strip()

    print(f"The owner of the folder {folder_path} is {owner}")
except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
    print(f"Error: {e}")

paragraphs.title: STEP 3.5 : separate flight and system, find the name of the new flight file
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
def old_version_separate_flight_and_system_filefrom_log_sharing_flight_df(log_sharing_flight_df):
    # read the df of all the log index file
    index_log_file_sharing_flight_df = log_sharing_flight_df
    
    vol_files_filter_expression = (F.col("Is_Vol") == True)
    system_files_filter_expression = (F.col("Is_System") == True)
    
    # We separate the previous df in 2 smaller df one with the flight file ant the other with the system file, both of them sorted by date
    vol_files_filtered_df = index_log_file_sharing_flight_df.filter(vol_files_filter_expression).orderBy(F.col("File_date_as_TimestampType").asc())
    system_files_filtered_df = index_log_file_sharing_flight_df.filter(system_files_filter_expression).orderBy(F.col("File_date_as_TimestampType").asc())
    return vol_files_filtered_df, system_files_filtered_df
    
def separate_flight_file_from_log_sharing_flight_df(log_sharing_flight_df):
    # read the df of all the log index file
    index_log_file_sharing_flight_df = log_sharing_flight_df
    vol_files_filter_expression = (F.col("Is_Vol") == True)
    # We separate the previous df in 2 smaller df one with the flight file ant the other with the system file, both of them sorted by date
    vol_files_filtered_df = index_log_file_sharing_flight_df.filter(vol_files_filter_expression).orderBy(F.col("File_date_as_TimestampType").asc())
    return vol_files_filtered_df

def separate_system_file_from_log_sharing_flight_df(log_sharing_flight_df):
    # read the df of all the log index file
    index_log_file_sharing_flight_df = log_sharing_flight_df
    system_files_filter_expression = (F.col("Is_System") == True)
    # We separate the previous df in 2 smaller df one with the flight file ant the other with the system file, both of them sorted by date
    system_files_filtered_df = index_log_file_sharing_flight_df.filter(system_files_filter_expression).orderBy(F.col("File_date_as_TimestampType").asc())
    return system_files_filtered_df

def is_SN_a_known_7X_serial_number(searched_SN, known_7X_SN_list = ['SN267', 'SN268', 'SN269', 'SN270', '267', '268', '269', '270', 267, 268, 269, 270]):
    return searched_SN in known_7X_SN_list

def is_SN_a_known_8X_serial_number(searched_SN, known_8X_SN_list = ['SN412', 'SN425', 'SN449', 'SN455', 'SN466', 'SN488', '412', '425', '449', '455', '466', 412, 425, 449, 455, 466, 488]):
    return searched_SN in known_8X_SN_list
    
def is_aircraft_model_number_a_known_Falcon_code(searched_aircraft_model, known_Falcon_code = ["0420", "0580", "420", "580", 420, 580]):
    return searched_aircraft_model in known_Falcon_code

def get_vol_file_name_from_vol_files_filtered_df(volFiles_filtered_df):
    # Since vol_files_filtered_df was sorted by date (File_date_as_TimestampType) in a previous function, we can extract all the infos we need reading only the first row
    first_row = volFiles_filtered_df.first()
    value_1_IRYS2_or_PERFOS = first_row["IRYS2_or_PERFOS"]
    value_2_File_aircraft_model = first_row["File_aircraft_model"]
    # If value_2_File_aircraft_model is not a recognised value change the code with an absormal value
    if not is_aircraft_model_number_a_known_Falcon_code(value_2_File_aircraft_model):
        value_2_File_aircraft_model = "0000"
        
    #value_3_File_SN = str(first_row["File_SN"])
    value_3_File_SN = strip_non_numeric_char_from_string(first_row["File_SN"])
    # If value_3_File_SN is not a recognised value change the code with an absormal value
    if not (is_SN_a_known_7X_serial_number(value_3_File_SN) or is_SN_a_known_8X_serial_number(value_3_File_SN)):
        value_3_File_SN = "000"
        
    value_4_File_date_as_String = first_row["File_date_as_String"]
    # The letter t was cut of in previous transformation to keep only digits
    value_5_missing_letter_t = "t"
    #value_6_vol_file_extension = ".parquet"
    
    vol_file_complete_name = value_1_IRYS2_or_PERFOS + value_2_File_aircraft_model + value_3_File_SN + "_" + value_4_File_date_as_String + value_5_missing_letter_t
    return vol_file_complete_name #, value_2_File_aircraft_model, value_3_File_SN

def collect_a_df_column_into_a_list(df, column_name_string):
    values_list = df.select(column_name_string).rdd.flatMap(lambda x: x).collect()
    return values_list

paragraphs.title: Using the list of vol file, find the name given to the complete vol parquet file
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
vol_file_name = get_vol_file_name_from_vol_files_filtered_df(volFiles_filtered_df)
print(vol_file_name)

paragraphs.title: Update the name of the flight into the corresponding log
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
# Collect the columns file_name_no_extension of the dataframe files_sharing_flight_df into a list of log files to be updated
threads = []
list_of_log_files_to_update = test_files_sharing_flight_df.select("file_name_no_extension").rdd.flatMap(lambda x: x).collect()
flight_file_name_without_extension = vol_file_name
new_values_per_column_dict["Flight_file_name"] = flight_file_name_without_extension

for log_file_to_update in list_of_log_files_to_update:
    # Check if the logfile already have the specified Flight_file_name value
    update_both_log_files(log_file_to_update, new_values_per_column_dict)
    thread = threading.Thread(target=thread_copy_and_move_raw_file_into_appropriate_folder, args=(new_raw_file_path,))
    threads.append(thread)
    thread.start()

for thread in threads:
    thread.join()

%pyspark

finding_common_flight_update_logs_threads = []

# Default path of the index log files
Log_files_Index_Dir_path = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_current_State_and_Index/*"
# Find all the logs files where the value of Flight_file_name is still None (files not associated with a flight file yet)

# Collect the values of the column file_name_no_extension into a list (the names of the files without extension that can be used to interact with the logs)
list_of_row_files_without_a_Flight_file_name = index_log_file_without_a_Flight_file_name_df.select("file_name_no_extension").rdd.flatMap(lambda x: x).collect()
# While the list is not empty, process the first file of the list
while list_of_row_files_without_a_Flight_file_name != []:
    updated_log_values_dict = {"Flight_file_name":"No_Flight_Identified"}
    file_name_without_extension_to_analyse = list_of_row_files_without_a_Flight_file_name[0]
    # files_sharing_flight_df is a dataframe where each row represent the data of a raw csv file. The dataframe regroup all the file identified as a part of the same flight/vol : same SN and and a 
    files_sharing_flight_df = find_files_sharing_the_same_flight_as_rawFileName(file_name_without_extension_to_analyse)
    # Using the files_sharing_flight_df, identify the files that belong to the future flight/vol file (the IRYS2 or PERFOS files, as opposed to the systems files)
    only_vol_flight_files_filtered_df = separate_flight_file_from_log_sharing_flight_df(files_sharing_flight_df)
    # Find the name of the future flight/vol file
    flight_vol_file_name_without_extension = get_vol_file_name_from_vol_files_filtered_df(only_vol_flight_files_filtered_df)
    # Dict of values to update in the logs files
    updated_log_values_dict["Flight_file_name"] = flight_vol_file_name_without_extension
    # List the current list identified as sharing the same flight
    list_of_row_files_to_update_with_a_Flight_file_name = files_sharing_flight_df.select("file_name_no_extension").rdd.flatMap(lambda x: x).collect()
    # Use threading to parallelize the list of update both logs jobs
    for file_name_without_extension_to_update in list_of_row_files_to_update_with_a_Flight_file_name:
        thread = threading.Thread(target=update_both_log_files, args=(file_name_without_extension_to_update, updated_log_values_dict))
        finding_common_flight_update_logs_threads.append(thread)
        thread.start()
    # Wait for all threads to finish
    for thread in finding_common_flight_update_logs_threads:
        thread.join()
    # Should work but to long better to loop through the remove
    #list_of_row_files_without_a_Flight_file_name = [item for item in original_list if item not in values_to_remove]
    # Since the list_of_row_files_to_update_with_a_Flight_file_name should be updated by the previous step, remove thoses values from list_of_row_files_without_a_Flight_file_name, to avoid processing the same files multiples times during the loops
    for values_to_remove in list_of_row_files_to_update_with_a_Flight_file_name:
        list_of_row_files_without_a_Flight_file_name.remove(values_to_remove)

def old_version_separate_flight_and_system_filefrom_log_sharing_flight_df(log_sharing_flight_df):
    # read the df of all the log index file
    index_log_file_sharing_flight_df = log_sharing_flight_df
    
    vol_files_filter_expression = (F.col("Is_Vol") == True)
    system_files_filter_expression = (F.col("Is_System") == True)
    
    # We separate the previous df in 2 smaller df one with the flight file ant the other with the system file, both of them sorted by date
    vol_files_filtered_df = index_log_file_sharing_flight_df.filter(vol_files_filter_expression).orderBy(F.col("File_date_as_TimestampType").asc())
    system_files_filtered_df = index_log_file_sharing_flight_df.filter(system_files_filter_expression).orderBy(F.col("File_date_as_TimestampType").asc())
    return vol_files_filtered_df, system_files_filtered_df
    
def separate_flight_file_from_log_sharing_flight_df(log_sharing_flight_df):
    # read the df of all the log index file
    index_log_file_sharing_flight_df = log_sharing_flight_df
    vol_files_filter_expression = (F.col("Is_Vol") == True)
    # We separate the previous df in 2 smaller df one with the flight file ant the other with the system file, both of them sorted by date
    vol_files_filtered_df = index_log_file_sharing_flight_df.filter(vol_files_filter_expression).orderBy(F.col("File_date_as_TimestampType").asc())
    return vol_files_filtered_df

def separate_system_file_from_log_sharing_flight_df(log_sharing_flight_df):
    # read the df of all the log index file
    index_log_file_sharing_flight_df = log_sharing_flight_df
    system_files_filter_expression = (F.col("Is_System") == True)
    # We separate the previous df in 2 smaller df one with the flight file ant the other with the system file, both of them sorted by date
    system_files_filtered_df = index_log_file_sharing_flight_df.filter(system_files_filter_expression).orderBy(F.col("File_date_as_TimestampType").asc())
    return system_files_filtered_df

def is_SN_a_known_7X_serial_number(searched_SN, known_7X_SN_list = ['SN267', 'SN268', 'SN269', 'SN270', '267', '268', '269', '270', 267, 268, 269, 270]):
    return searched_SN in known_7X_SN_list

def is_SN_a_known_8X_serial_number(searched_SN, known_8X_SN_list = ['SN412', 'SN425', 'SN449', 'SN455', 'SN466', 'SN488', '412', '425', '449', '455', '466', 412, 425, 449, 455, 466, 488]):
    return searched_SN in known_8X_SN_list
    
def is_aircraft_model_number_a_known_Falcon_code(searched_aircraft_model, known_Falcon_code = ["0420", "0580", "420", "580", 420, 580]):
    return searched_aircraft_model in known_Falcon_code

def get_vol_file_name_from_vol_files_filtered_df(volFiles_filtered_df):
    # Since vol_files_filtered_df was sorted by date (File_date_as_TimestampType) in a previous function, we can extract all the infos we need reading only the first row
    first_row = volFiles_filtered_df.first()
    value_1_IRYS2_or_PERFOS = first_row["IRYS2_or_PERFOS"]
    value_2_File_aircraft_model = first_row["File_aircraft_model"]
    # If value_2_File_aircraft_model is not a recognised value change the code with an absormal value
    if not is_aircraft_model_number_a_known_Falcon_code(value_2_File_aircraft_model):
        value_2_File_aircraft_model = "0000"
        
    #value_3_File_SN = str(first_row["File_SN"])
    value_3_File_SN = strip_non_numeric_char_from_string(first_row["File_SN"])
    # If value_3_File_SN is not a recognised value change the code with an absormal value
    if not (is_SN_a_known_7X_serial_number(value_3_File_SN) or is_SN_a_known_8X_serial_number(value_3_File_SN)):
        value_3_File_SN = "000"
        
    value_4_File_date_as_String = first_row["File_date_as_String"]
    # The letter t was cut of in previous transformation to keep only digits
    value_5_missing_letter_t = "t"
    #value_6_vol_file_extension = ".parquet"
    
    vol_file_complete_name = value_1_IRYS2_or_PERFOS + value_2_File_aircraft_model + value_3_File_SN + "_" + value_4_File_date_as_String + value_5_missing_letter_t
    return vol_file_complete_name #, value_2_File_aircraft_model, value_3_File_SN

def collect_a_df_column_into_a_list(df, column_name_string):
    values_list = df.select(column_name_string).rdd.flatMap(lambda x: x).collect()
    return values_list

            # List the current list identified as sharing the same flight
            try:
                list_of_row_files_to_update_with_a_Flight_file_name = files_sharing_flight_df.select("file_name_no_extension").rdd.flatMap(lambda x: x).collect()

            # Use threading to parallelize the list of update both logs jobs
            try:
                for file_name_without_extension_to_update in list_of_row_files_to_update_with_a_Flight_file_name:
                    thread = threading.Thread(target=update_both_log_files_with_success_accumulators, args=(file_name_without_extension_to_update, updated_log_values_dict))
                    finding_common_flight_update_logs_threads.append(thread)

            try:

%pyspark
from pyspark.sql.functions import col, unix_timestamp
from pyspark.sql.window import Window

def group_files_by_time(dataframe, time_column, time_window_seconds):
    # Convert the time_column to a timestamp
    dataframe = dataframe.withColumn(time_column, unix_timestamp(col(time_column)).cast("timestamp"))
    
    # Define a window specification based on the time_column
    window_spec = Window.orderBy(col(time_column))
    
    # Create a new column with a time window based on time_window_seconds
    dataframe = dataframe.withColumn("time_window", F.window(col(time_column), f"{time_window_seconds} seconds"))
    
    # Group rows by the time window
    grouped_df = dataframe.groupBy("time_window").agg(F.collect_list("file_name_no_extension").alias("files_in_window"))
    
    return grouped_df

%pyspark
def group_files_by_time(dataframe, time_column, time_window_seconds):
    # Convert the time_column to a timestamp
    dataframe = dataframe.withColumn(time_column, unix_timestamp(col(time_column)).cast("timestamp"))
    
    # Define a window specification based on the time_column
    window_spec = Window.orderBy(col(time_column))
    
    # Create a new column with a time window based on time_window_seconds
    #dataframe = dataframe.withColumn("time_window_start", F.window(col(time_column), f"{time_window_seconds} seconds"))
    dataframe = dataframe.withColumn("time_window_start", F.window(col(time_column), f"{time_window_seconds} seconds"))
    
    # Group rows by the time window start
    grouped_df = dataframe.groupBy("time_window_start").agg(
        F.collect_list("file_name_no_extension").alias("files_in_window"),
        F.min(col(time_column)).alias("time_window_min"),
        F.max(col(time_column)).alias("time_window_max")
    ).withColumn("time_window_end", F.expr("time_window_start + interval 220 seconds"))
    
    return grouped_df

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

def group_files_by_time(dataframe, time_column, time_window_seconds):
    # Convert the time_column to a timestamp
    dataframe = dataframe.withColumn(time_column, unix_timestamp(col(time_column)).cast("timestamp"))
    
    # Define a window specification based on the time_column
    window_spec = Window.orderBy(col(time_column))
    
    # Create a new column with a time window based on time_window_seconds
    dataframe = dataframe.withColumn("time_window_start", F.window(col(time_column), f"{time_window_seconds} seconds"))
    
    # Calculate time_window_end as a timestamp by adding seconds
    dataframe = dataframe.withColumn("time_window_end", col("time_window_start") + F.expr(f"INTERVAL {time_window_seconds} SECONDS"))
    
    # Group rows by the time window start
    grouped_df = dataframe.groupBy("time_window_start").agg(
        F.collect_list("file_name_no_extension").alias("files_in_window"),
        F.min(col(time_column)).alias("time_window_min"),
        F.max(col(time_column)).alias("time_window_max")
    )
    
    return grouped_df

Log_files_Index_Dir_path = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_current_State_and_Index/*"
index_log_file_df = read_all_index_log_files_as_a_single_df(Log_files_Index_Dir_path).orderBy(F.col("File_date_as_TimestampType").asc())
grouped_files_df = group_files_by_time(index_log_file_df, "File_date_as_TimestampType", 220)
print("row count = ", grouped_files_df.count())
grouped_files_df.show(150, truncate=150)

%pyspark

def group_files_by_time(dataframe, time_column, time_window_seconds):
    # Convert the time_column to a timestamp
    dataframe = dataframe.withColumn(time_column, unix_timestamp(col(time_column)).cast("timestamp"))
    
    # Define a window specification based on the time_column
    window_spec = Window.orderBy(col(time_column))
    
    # Create a new column with a time window based on time_window_seconds
    dataframe = dataframe.withColumn("time_window_start", F.window(col(time_column), f"{time_window_seconds} seconds"))
    
    # Calculate time_window_end as a timestamp by adding seconds
    dataframe = dataframe.withColumn("time_window_end", col("time_window_start") + F.expr(f"INTERVAL {time_window_seconds} SECONDS"))
    
    # Group rows by the time window start
    grouped_df = dataframe.groupBy("time_window_start").agg(
        F.collect_list("file_name_no_extension").alias("files_in_window"),
        F.min(col(time_column)).alias("time_window_min"),
        F.max(col(time_column)).alias("time_window_max")
    )
    
    return grouped_df

Log_files_Index_Dir_path = "/datalake/prod/c2/ddd/crm/acmf/Log_ACMF_Files/ACMF_current_State_and_Index/*"

grouped_files_df = group_files_by_time(index_log_file_df, "File_date_as_TimestampType", 220)
print("row count = ", grouped_files_df.count())
grouped_files_df.show(150, truncate=150)

from pyspark.sql.functions import col, unix_timestamp, when

def group_files_by_time(dataframe, time_column, time_window_seconds):
    # Convert the time_column to a timestamp, handling non-timestamp values
    dataframe = dataframe.withColumn(time_column, when(col(time_column).cast("timestamp").isNotNull(), col(time_column).cast("timestamp")))
    
    # Define a window specification based on the time_column
    window_spec = Window.orderBy(col(time_column))
    
    # Create a new column with a time window based on time_window_seconds
    dataframe = dataframe.withColumn("time_window_start", F.window(col(time_column), f"{time_window_seconds} seconds"))
    
    # Calculate time_window_end as a timestamp by adding seconds
    dataframe = dataframe.withColumn("time_window_end", when(col(time_column).cast("timestamp").isNotNull(), col("time_window_start") + F.expr(f"INTERVAL {time_window_seconds} SECONDS")))
    
    # Group rows by the time window start
    grouped_df = dataframe.groupBy("time_window_start").agg(
        F.collect_list("file_name_no_extension").alias("files_in_window"),
        F.min(col(time_column)).alias("time_window_min"),
        F.max(col(time_column)).alias("time_window_max")
    )
    
    return grouped_df
